snippet: In their efforts to attract children, television networks are starting to show programs online before they appear on old-fashioned TV.
abstract: Television networks, in effort to attract and retain child viewers, are starting to show programs online before they appear on old-fashioned TV; stalwarts like Nickelodeon and Disney Channel are rolling out new programs in order to fend off competition from Netflix, Amazon and other streaming services whose instantly available programming is new norm among young viewers.
lead_paragraph: In their efforts to attract children, television networks are starting to show programs online before they appear on old-fashioned TV.

headline.main: Same Time, Same Channel? TV Woos Kids Who Can’t Wait
headline.print_headline: Same Time, Same Channel? TV Woos Kids Who Can’t Wait
